ModuleDescription: This module employs tools from microeconomic analysis to explain the urbanization process and the operation of real estate markets. The topics include economic factors driving city formation; market forces shaping the urban spatial structure; determinants of metropolitan and regional growth; quality of life measurements; urban sprawl and skyscrapers; urban transportation; neighbourhoods and racial/income segregation; land-use regulations; and urban governance.
Prerequisite: RE1704 Principles of Real Estate Economics
Preclusion:
RE2102 Real Estate Economics
EC3381 Urban Economics
